verses.verse: Come<WH3212>, and let us return<WH7725> unto the LORD<WH3068>: for he hath torn<WH2963>, and he will heal<WH7495> us; he hath smitten<WH5221>, and he will bind us up<WH2280>.
After two days<WH3117> will he revive<WH2421> us: in the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> he will raise us up<WH6965>, and we shall live<WH2421> in his sight<WH6440>.

Then shall we know<WH3045>, if we follow<WH7291> on to know<WH3045> the LORD<WH3068>: his going forth<WH4161> is prepared<WH3559> as the morning<WH7837>; and he shall come<WH935> unto us as the rain<WH1653>, as the latter<WH4456> and former rain<WH3384> unto the earth<WH776>.

Â¶ O Ephraim<WH669>, what shall I do<WH6213> unto thee? O Judah<WH3063>, what shall I do<WH6213> unto thee? for your goodness<WH2617> is as a morning<WH1242> cloud<WH6051>, and as the early<WH7925> dew<WH2919> it goeth away<WH1980>.

Therefore have I hewed<WH2672> them by the prophets<WH5030>; I have slain<WH2026> them by the words<WH561> of my mouth<WH6310>: and thy judgments<WH4941> are as the light<WH216> that goeth forth<WH3318>.
For I desired<WH2654> mercy<WH2617>, and not sacrifice<WH2077>; and the knowledge<WH1847> of God<WH430> more than burnt offerings<WH5930>.
But they like men<WH120> have transgressed<WH5674> the covenant<WH1285>: there have they dealt treacherously<WH898> against me.
Gilead<WH1568> is a city<WH7151> of them that work<WH6466> iniquity<WH205>, and is polluted<WH6121> with blood<WH1818>.

And as troops<WH1416> of robbers wait<WH2442> for a man<WH376>, so the company<WH2267> of priests<WH3548> murder<WH7523> in the way<WH1870> by consent<WH7926><WH7927>: for they commit<WH6213> lewdness<WH2154>.
I have seen<WH7200> an horrible thing<WH8186> in the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>: there is the whoredom<WH2184> of Ephraim<WH669>, Israel<WH3478> is defiled<WH2930>.
Also, O Judah<WH3063>, he hath set<WH7896> an harvest<WH7105> for thee, when I returned<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of my people<WH5971>.
